# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is the Julia code that solves your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if line_length + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            line_length = 0
        elseif !isempty(wrapped_text)
            wrapped_text *= " "
            line_length += 1
        end
        
        wrapped_text *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end

    return wrapped_text
end
```

You can test the function with your example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

The output will be:

```
This function 
will wrap 
words into 
lines
```
